meanings.definition: Not adhering to or characterized by dogma.
meanings.sent1: She had an undogmatic approach to solving problems, always willing to consider different viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: The undogmatic teacher encouraged her students to think for themselves and question everything.
meanings.sent3: The undogmatic chef decided to experiment with unconventional ingredients in her famous dish.
meanings.sent4: His undogmatic leadership style allowed for creativity to flourish within the team.
meanings.sent5: The undogmatic artist blended various art styles to create a unique masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Not rigidly following a set of beliefs or principles.
meanings.sent1: The undogmatic explorer was always open to changing his route based on new information.
meanings.sent2: Being undogmatic in her approach, she was willing to adapt her opinions when presented with new evidence.
meanings.sent3: The undogmatic book club decided to read a genre none of them had tried before.
meanings.sent4: His undogmatic thinking allowed him to see solutions others might have overlooked.
meanings.sent5: The undogmatic scientist was open to revising her hypothesis based on the experiment results.

meanings.definition: Open to new ideas or perspectives.
meanings.sent1: The undogmatic student eagerly listened to different viewpoints during the debate.
meanings.sent2: She remained undogmatic in her beliefs, always willing to learn from others.
meanings.sent3: The undogmatic group of friends decided to try a new hobby together.
meanings.sent4: His undogmatic nature made him a great collaborator in brainstorming sessions.
meanings.sent5: The undogmatic team leader welcomed suggestions from all team members.
